components.name: orders
components.description: Provides REST API endpoints for order management.

components.name: processor
components.description: Handles payment processing for the e-commerce API.

Create a New Order.description: This endpoint allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Send a POST request to '/api/orders/create' with the required data in the request body.
Verify the response status code. If it's 201, the order was created successfully; otherwise, handle the error based on the HTTPException status code.

Get Order Details.description: This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID. Users can only access their own orders.

steps.description: Send a GET request to '/api/orders/{order_id}' where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order you want to retrieve.
Check the response status code. If it's 200, the order details were retrieved successfully; otherwise, handle the error based on the HTTPException status code.

List User Orders.description: This endpoint lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via 'limit' and 'offset' parameters.

steps.description: Send a GET request to '/api/orders/' with optional query parameters 'limit' and 'offset'.
Check the response status code. If it's 200, the list of orders was retrieved successfully; otherwise, handle the error based on the HTTPException status code.

Cancel an Order.description: This endpoint allows users to cancel a pending order. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.

steps.description: Send a POST request to '/api/orders/{order_id}/cancel' where {order_id} is the unique identifier of the order you want to cancel.
Check the response status code. If it's 200, the order was cancelled successfully; otherwise, handle the error based on the HTTPException status code.
